website_summaries.verdict: Reasonably priced road bike that delivers impressive precision in the brakes and shifting.
pros: Brake and shifters are integrated together for ease of use
Aluminum frame provides a great mix of toughness and lightweight design
3 sizes to help you properly fit the bike
Easy to reach top speeds on flat ground

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to take it to a bike shop for tuneup, otherwise you will ruin your bike and your experience.
customer_reviews.text: After I spent about $75 per bike on tuneup, I got a great machine in a low $400 price range (bike + shipping + tuneup). I also immediately replaced the seat with Planet Bike A.R.S. Anatomic Relief Bicycle Saddle. Finally, I installed Foxnovo Bicycle Kickstand. PROS: lighweight, STI shifters, good quality - and not just for the money. Greatest value/price ratio. CONS: one tube blew per bike, which means it was not fitted properly at the factory. I called Customer Service, and they sent me replacements relatively quickly. Basic cheap saddle. No kickstand. I just want to underscore that the bicycle comes NOT TUNED, so factor extra $70-$100 into the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Twister

customer_reviews.title: I assemblied in hour or two - once i got accustomed to racer type I now love it.
customer_reviews.text: i am a real biker - commute to work and back - groceries.. not so much on this bike... but as all the reviews said.. replace the tires, tubes, seat, add cages, I assemblied in hour or two - once i got accustomed to racer type I now love it... only regret I should do disc brakes but its smooth, fast, light weight so rougher ride than I had its a smasshing good deal.. i get compliments on the bike all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Moore

customer_reviews.title: Better than I'd hoped!
customer_reviews.text: Quite a lot of bike for the low cost. Assembly was a snap, took about 30 minutes to go from box to road. This bike is a really nice ride, the Tourney shifters are smooth and easy. Saddle is comfortable enough, and it feels lighter than I'd expected for an aluminum frame. The brakes look OK, the pads seem a bit on the cheap side, but they stop the bike just fine, I took it on a long, steep, curving downhill with no problems. I ride mostly on a relatively flat asphalt trail and this bike can go. I got this as a low-cost replacement for a decades-old Schwinn and so far it's fully lived up to expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Stauss

customer_reviews.title: Great Entry Level bike
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Such a great buy. Bought this to train and compete in my first triathlon but did not want to spend thousands, did hours of research and settled on this bike with no regrets was able to keep up with competitors with much more expensive bikes and at around 150 miles have not had any problems. Added shimano clip pedals, continental gatorskin tires, seat cushion, tool pouch, storage pouch, and dual bottle holders. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I cannot imagine a better entry-level bike for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this bike! I will admit is my first road bike, so I am not the most experienced with the style, but I feel at home on it. It rides fast, catches eyes, and feels very natural in spite of my being 6'2". It has me addicted to cycling. I will echo others' comment about the saddle being a bit hard. I did 5 miles the first day and was a bit sore, but with a $10 cover it is more than comfortable enough for doing at least 10 miles (I have yet to do more than that, yet).
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent introduction to a road bike with dropping a ton of cash. It’s very light and I’ve put on about 500 miles at this point. Like other reviewers have said the tires are thin and they wore down pretty quick. I didn’t have many flats at first for several months, but recently I’ve had multiple flats in a row. So after a few hundred miles you may want to consider upgrading the tires. Other than that this is a very solid bike worth your time and money if you are just getting into road riding.
customer_reviews.author: Multi-Interest guy

customer_reviews.title: Solid, inexpensive bike
customer_reviews.text: We're using this exclusively on an indoor trainer, so I can't speak to its handling on the road. We swapped the stock pedals and seat, but did no other customization. I think handlebars may be next, though, these are a little on the small side. If you're looking to get into riding or want something to use as a permanent trainer bike, this is a good deal. The frame seems well made and it comes with solid beginner grade components. We did not assemble it ourselves, instead taking it to a local bike shop. I'd recommend everyone do that, as the packaging says something about needing professional assembly to validate the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: CMR

customer_reviews.title: Decent bike
customer_reviews.text: The bike is a decent built, great for beginners looking for a cheap starter bike. I was riding in on sand and gravel trail one day(about 20mi) and there was no problem whatsoever. The next day I was riding it on the road, I got a flat tire, LOL. When I took it for repair, the repairman suggested that I get the inner rubber lining replaced as it wasn't of good quality (I am talking about a rubber lining which resides between the metal tire frame and the tube, not sure what is it called). He also told me that the Vilano is generally a low built bike and not for extensive use
customer_reviews.author: Shreeya

customer_reviews.title: Very clean looking, but they tried to cut some corners.....
customer_reviews.text: I would give it four stars if the bike didn't come with a 3-speed shifter for the front crank-set when it only has 2 cranks. You have to be careful and not fully shift it or the chain will come off. I understand trying to offer a bike at the lowest price possible..hence cheaper parts are used, but using the wrong shifter intentionally is pretty crummy.
customer_reviews.author: Josh King

customer_reviews.title: Great bike, amazing customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I went out for a 20 mile ride first day I got this bike and beat my average, but whether it was a factory error or my fault the pedal came out of the crank arm and stripped it. The customer service people were wonderful and helped me out and I am super greatful. But so far as I can tell it seems to be a pretty good bike for the money I plan to upgrade the slightly cheaper components but I think if you didnt it would be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan West

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bike and a good value.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice bike. Was delivered earlier than expected. I would have liked to be able to put it together myself. Only downside for me was that I needed to take it to a bike shop and pay to get assembly finished. Front brakes needed to be moved with spacers so that the wheel would spin freely and tuning the retailers. I still recommend this bike it's very good value.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, smooth and fast.
customer_reviews.text: If you're an Uber professional who wants a carbon fiber super lightweight bike, skip it. If you're in the market for a sweet looking, smooth riding, speed demon of a bike with integrated shifting for under $500, this is your bike.
customer_reviews.author: Kachi Mozie

customer_reviews.title: I wouldnt buy it again
customer_reviews.text: The bike overall is alright. You get what you pay for. The seat is extremely uncomfortable for me, and the brakes leave a lot to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Bicycle works well. I tried to assemble and tune ...
customer_reviews.text: Bicycle works well. I tried to assemble and tune myself but it endes up being a disaster. No matter how many videos I'd watch could get the deraillaur tuned. I ended up jamming the STI shifters, the cabke was internally dislodged. Ended up going to the local mechanic.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: ... for an intro bike to see if I would like cycling and this has been perfect for that
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an intro bike to see if I would like cycling and this has been perfect for that. Not top of the line, but it gets the job done and I haven't had any issues with it. Seeing as I don't know much about bikes, and after reading some reviews on amazon before purchasing, I did take this bike to be assembled at a bike shop instead of putting it together and tuning it myself and I don't regret that decision. Fantastic beginners bike for someone looking to not break the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Good bike for beginner!
customer_reviews.text: I am one of beginning riders. I have purchased 53" due to my height (5'7"). Easy installation, I purchases hex wrench to thighten pedals. Still the height of saddle is high, so I cut the pipe of saddle to 2 inches. Now, I am very happy with riding every morning. Good Bike!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: Great bike, fairly easy to put together. Very professional ride for reasonable price. Could use brake lever on the top handle bar, but u get used to it. Probably 2-3 mph boost from old bike.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Keough

customer_reviews.title: Check the size guide and I didn't add the assembly package at the same time!
customer_reviews.text: This is the present for bike lover husband. Perfectly nice and looking really cool and light. I didn't add the assembly package, but it seems okay to do later by self! And I followed the size guide, and it works good!
customer_reviews.author: hwanjaengi

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the money
customer_reviews.text: I use this bike to get my miles in. Great for up hills no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect starter bike.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I have been very happy with this bike. I am new to this sport and on a budget. I have been commuting 15 miles each way to work while training for a triathlon sprint. On this bike I would say for a starter bike it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... to be fully intact and looks to be a good bike after unboxing and assembling
customer_reviews.text: While the bike seems to be fully intact and looks to be a good bike after unboxing and assembling, which took maybe 30 min, I realized that the box didn’t come with pedals, an owners manual, nor the pin to attach the front wheel. Therefore I’m not able to ride this bike even if I wanted to. Time to see how customer service helps
customer_reviews.author: EPrimeW

customer_reviews.title: Decent bike plus easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: This bike is a good value for the money, but I do not respect the seller at all for not responding when I had issues with some broken parts.
customer_reviews.author: ELMO

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I've ridden the bike a few hundred miles...it's perfectly adequate and a great value. The tires are marginal but that's an easy fix.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: This bike is awesome not one complaint except I swapped the seat out ...
customer_reviews.text: Just bought my vilano a few months ago already put close to 300 miles on it. This bike is awesome not one complaint except I swapped the seat out for a more comfortable one. It picks up speed really well and if you get on it, it's pretty quick. All and all I think its the best bang for your buck out there.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Terrific!
customer_reviews.text: Great bike for what I paid. Visually the bikes looks stunning, and performs well for the level of bike you get. If you are thinking about getting into road cycling this is the way to go. Could not be happier with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bike
customer_reviews.text: I would give this bike 6 stars if I could I've wanted a road bike read reviews on this so I bought it nice price came in excellent condition nothing missing took it to bike shop to have it assembled road it 24 miles first day
customer_reviews.author: chad johnston

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice bike. Easy to assemble but adjustments can be complicated so I took mine to a bike shop. $10 for adjustments. It’s way faster on the road than my Walmart mountain bike. It’s quiet and gear changes are smooth.
customer_reviews.author: keith

customer_reviews.title: cool bicycle
customer_reviews.text: very good purchase to start and very light with some upgrade will be better, I did change the saddle for one carbon fiber, take a look the new look :) * 1-15-19 I add the carbon Fiber rudder and reflective decal, take a look last 2 pictures
customer_reviews.author: Ribai M.

customer_reviews.title: Good bike, but came broken and missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Nice bike but when it arrived there were a few problems. A spoke on the front wheel was already snapped. In addition the rear tire brake line has a quick twist to tighten the brakes without having to unscrew it, but it came with the cheap plastic piece already broken as well, so i have to adjust the brakes manually. lastly the clamp that lets you attach the bike to the seat was missing. Overall its a nice bike but came with a few issues.
customer_reviews.author: Tomer

customer_reviews.title: This bike is beautiful sleek and moderately light
customer_reviews.text: A lot depends on WHO writes the review too :). I am not a pro biker and bought this for my 14 year old son. I had Amazon provided pro coming over for assembly. Just 1 day is gone. This bike is beautiful sleek and moderately light. We dad and and son love it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Siraj Ghosh

customer_reviews.title: shadow2 is awesome.. easy to change shift lever and smooth
customer_reviews.text: shadow2 is awesome..easy to change shift lever and smooth..looks good and moden stylish.. Low price but quality bike, recommend to everyone else...
customer_reviews.author: kiho hahn

customer_reviews.title: Great entry level bike
customer_reviews.text: This is my rfirst oad bike. It isn't perfect but for the price, it rides well. It was easy to assemble and have had no problems yet! I would definitely recommend this bike to anyone who wants to get into cycling.
customer_reviews.author: RMao

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I am new to biking. I have been a runner for the last two years, and once summer hits, I stop running as much. This year I thought biking, and I had an older, heavier, cheaper 21 speed. After a few months of riding it, I decided it was time to invest a little more money. Cheapest that I could find a good bike at a store was $600.00, and I wasn't ready for that, so I bought this. I think it is a great bike. It's fairly lite, it has great shifters, it feels great when riding. I did have it professionally assembled, but it is just a wonderful bike for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: 500miles in and happy
customer_reviews.text: Cannot vouch for the quality of this bike at this price point enough. Constantly told it looks and rides like a much more expensive bike. 500miles in on the original parts including both inner tubes. That's quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Hurst

customer_reviews.title: The gear shifting is terrible though. It is NOT SMOOTH in the slightest
customer_reviews.text: It's okay. The gear shifting is terrible though. It is NOT SMOOTH in the slightest, but you're buying a road bike for cheap so you get what you pay for. I did take it to a local bike shop and they suggested replacing both of them. He deemed them "unusable". The bike overall is light though, and it does give you a gentle ride. I replaced a lot of the stock on the bike I.E. the brakes/seat/peddles.
customer_reviews.author: Eden H

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice bike for the money. Assembly was simple. Shifts great, lightweight, and fast!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen G.

customer_reviews.title: The Bes Bike Ever
customer_reviews.text: The bike is fast and light easy to use i really recommend this bike.
customer_reviews.author: Dauri

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great bike for the price! I bought a memory foam seat cushion since the seat wasn't too comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Great bike, no complaints. Buy it and ride all summer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought new tube and fine so far
customer_reviews.text: When I received bike. Bike front tire tube has leaking. I bought new tube and fine so far. Except that, overall quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: Ho W. Sun

customer_reviews.title: My tire popped a few days in, but I ...
customer_reviews.text: My tire popped a few days in, but I haven't had a problem since. It feels very high end for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Good bike, the screws easily strip and the gears ...
customer_reviews.text: Good bike, the screws easily strip and the gears do not change that great. Overall good bike for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Front inter-tube was bad. Other than that, not a bad bike.
customer_reviews.author: James Williams

customer_reviews.title: Mehhh....
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I was pretty excited to get this for my first road bike. I had a local bike shop put it together and rode about 25 miles before returning it. The shifting is terrible, it's too stiff, and just wasn't what I was looking for. I read a review someone wrote about spending the extra money on a name brand bike and I couldn't agree more. But for the price you get what you pay for, just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: tray

customer_reviews.title: but it's not perfect. I'm having trouble getting the shifting tuned
customer_reviews.text: This bike is a bargain at just over 300 dollars, but it's not perfect. I'm having trouble getting the shifting tuned, maybe because of the cable stretching or maybe some other reason. It works okay, but sometimes can be slow to shift and even if I keep messing with the barrel adjuster I just can't quite find the sweet spot. Something creaks when I ride, I think it might be the seat. And the tires are pretty low quality, lots of flash on them. But the thing's like 200 dollars cheaper than any other bike I could find with integrated shifters, so I'm ok with it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew McConaha

customer_reviews.title: Well made and light weight
customer_reviews.text: Bike was delivered on time and well package. Assembly was straight forward took a few hours, some reviews say only 30 minutes, but to really be done correctly a couple of hours should be the time to you would need. Because of weather I have not been able to ride my bike yet. Bike seems well made and very light weight. The reason I only gave 4 stars is because I have not had a chance to ride bike yet.
customer_reviews.author: Terry W.

customer_reviews.title: but I love!!
customer_reviews.text: I am not much of a rider, but I love!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this is a great entry level road bike
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this is a great entry level road bike. Had no problems assembling it and getting it road worthy. I've put about 100 miles on it so far and everything is running smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Olson

customer_reviews.title: Could not be more pleased. Incredible value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Could not be more pleased. Incredible value for the money. Wheels were a little out of true from shipping, but I corrected then and good to go. I absolutely love this bike. Take the time to true the wheels and set the brakes up, as well as fine tune the derailleurs and this bike rocks for under $300. Swap the seat too, as factory was aittle underpadded for me. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great bike and Service
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bike, unfortunately hit a hole in the rode and poped my tire the 3rd time riding it. I contacted them not expecting them to replace it for me (more so to see if they had a recommendation for a replacement size) but they sent me a new tube for free! Excellent service by Vilano and I can't wait to get back on my new bike. I will be much more aware of holes in the road in the future (I am used to mountain bikes this is my first road bike)
customer_reviews.author: Ian W.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good overall for an entry starter but both tires needed to be replaced after the first two rides..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bike the best value
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike cycling for less great company to deal with. Vilano very light weight bike. cycling for less very are very friendly and good to deal with Thanks Howard
customer_reviews.author: Johandy P.

customer_reviews.title: good deal great reviews
customer_reviews.text: good bike for a average road rider. Value and look are great. Did take to bike shop for fine tuning..Can be upgraded with ease.. completed 2 50 ml rides great . Added clip pedals and shoes OUTSTANDING RESULTS..
customer_reviews.author: Whitney price

customer_reviews.title: great starter roady
customer_reviews.text: my son's bike. We took it to a bike shop to be assembled and a tune up was included. Nice starter road bike. He is 5' 11" and we purchased the large size.
customer_reviews.author: odin8117

product_meta.title: Vilano Shadow 2.0 Road Bike - STI Integrated Shifters
feature_bullets: STI Integrated Brake Lever/Shifters offer precise and controllable braking and shifting in a convenient single unit designed for the road
6061 Double Butted Aluminum Aero Frame w/ Integrated Headset
Wheelset: 700c Doubled Walled CNC Machined Side

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
